comment: Horrible professor. She does not grade English papers like they should be graded. She does not grade on content, but on grammar and MLA.

Sharon Condon only graded for grammar mistakes, and was not clear with her directions. She always talked about her life and contradicted herself when it cam e to writing. She does not grade for content and what actually matters in a paper. Do not take her.

At first I thought Mrs. Condon would be a great teacher from the reviews I read, but in reality they were further from the truth. Mrs. Condon is a poor excuse of a professor, she rarely teaches anything at all, is often rude when you try to answer question and has no notes what so ever on the material. If you are a poor writer find some one else

Professor Condon is a tough grader. My highest grade on a paper was an 82 when I usually receive A's on papers. She rambles forever and never on subject. If you are a strong writer then this will be easy but if you struggle, I don't suggest her class.

If you are not a strong writer (especially w/ grammar), do not take this this professor unless you are prepared to work hard and improve. If you are strong, professor Condon's class will be a breeze. She sometimes seems cold and unapproachable, but she is usually willing to answer any questions you may have. Be prepared for some sass though.

She rambles a lot. She grades very harsh. She will fix something on your rough draft then count it wrong on the final sometimes. She is rude if you approach her for help. You have 4 major essays and 2 rhetorical analyses(250 words) in between each essay (8 in all) and 4 quizzes over the readings(very easy). Not a hard class at all

Nice lady but very particular on certain things. She grades papers more off of grammar and structure as opposed to grading the content. She does tend to go off on tangents and repeats herself. Her class is structured with four papers and reading assessments between each paper.
Very rude and inconsiderate at times...often rambles about irrelevant things in class. The assignments are not hard, just a lot of reading and writing small papers but she grades HARSH

She's a nice lady but takes 20 points off your grade for a fragment or run on. She doesnt really grade on content, mostly grammar. Good class if you have quality writing skills. You write essays almost every week.

an ok class as m=long as you do all of the assignments. there is a good amount of reading and writing assignments, but those are not bad at all. the only issue; she was very harsh on grading and when i would come to ask a question, she was always very cold and rude to me for no reason. an a is definitely manageable with all extra credit options
Professor is not interesting at all. She is actually quite boring, but she is not too difficult. She grades papers mostly on punctuation mistakes rather than content. Not the best but not the worst.

She has you cover 4 themes, read 6 articles from txt book for each theme, complete 1 analysis on 1 article for every 3 articles, and then take a quiz on all 6 articles, then write an essay based on the theme. Do your work. She will be friendly if you show hard work or a decent amount. But most of the work is done out of class. I got an A :)
She can be confusing at times and go off on tangents. 4 major essays and several quizzes. She doesn't know how to manage her time well though, I ended up being late for my next class often.

Professor Condon is a good professor if you want to learn how to write. If you are not a strong writer i recommend you take her . You will leave the class as a better writer .grammar and deadlines are key.

Professor Condon is very nice and helpful. She does not care about the content of your paper whatsoever, just the grammar and structure.(Which she will personally correct before the paper is due if you ask). Numerous easy assignments accompany the 4 main papers. This class is very straight forward and an A is easily achievable. Take it!

Professor Condon is a very nice lady and is witty.  She however speaks in circles at times which is annoying.  I received an A - but she is not an easy A.  She makes herself available for questions and knows her stuff.  I learned more from her than any other english instructor EVER!

A nice lady, with college level expectations. My A came as follows write paper, revise, go to writing lab, revise, then have the teacher go over it with you THATS RIGHT, the teacher went over all of my papers with me theres no excuse for doing poorly in this class. I would definitely recommend this woman- shes not an easy A, but you'll be glad.
The class organized, and those complaining about there papers should have gone to the writing lab or asked her. Thats right she'll read your paper for you before you turn it in.

She is extremely knowledgable and is dedicated to making sure you learn how to write papers properly. She is extremely clear on how she grades and tells you up front how many points will be taken off for each error.

She's very approachable, but I found her really not very helpful.  She counts off rediculous amounts of points for minor errors, especially run on sentences, at least 20 points per hit.If you are already a very good writer who can turn everything in on time with no issues, then no worries, if you have room to improve, take someone else!!
Do not take her. Bad class ,bad methods...
She is nice but counts off for everything on your papers if your grammar is not up to par DO NOT TAKE HER your grade will suffer... If you write good papers with no grammar issues very easy.
Loved her, very nice lady.
Not Helpful at all is right!  20 points off for a minor error. Watch those accidental run on sentences! You wont learn anything. DONT TAKE HER!!

Very sweet and understanding lady. She will ramble a lot and repeat herself at least 3 times per class.  Although she is very easy, and will read and correct your papers before you turn them in.  There is plenty of extra credit in this class.  If you are wanting an easy A then this is the class for you.  Just beware, you wont learn a damn thing.

I cannot stand this woman. She is so awful in explaining herself and the class. She doesn't use grammar rules that are up-to-date and excessively deducts papers. For instance she took 20 points off of my paper for a minor error (a typo). She isn't understanding when you try to explain either. Steer clear of her.

Not helpful. Goes off on tangents during explanations of important things, very hard to follow. Apparently has no problem with mocking a student in class, even when the student is not there. Very disappointing.
Very sweet lady. Always understanding and helpful. Probably the easiest english teacher I've had since i've been at KSU.
No Comments

Very sweet person, never made us stay longer than we had to, very helpful and always understanding.  for all her good qualities i would put up with the "rambling" and i wanted to take her again for 1102 but her class was full.

A sweet, southern woman with a wonderful personality.  She rambles a little, but she's a wonderful teacher nonetheless. Her class was fairly easy, and she made every effort possible to help her students.
Well I think she's a good teacher, but she does talk a lot. She always understands if you need to turn in papers late. She's cool.
Talks forever, says very little. rambles on about nothing for 15 minutes at a time, VERY boring.  If you feel like killing yourself, she will make you do it.
